resources.string: OS Virtual Lab is an educational application that allows you to simulate the algorithms that make an Operating System (OS) work.

1. The CPU 
2. The Memory 
3. The Input/Output (I/O) System 
4. The File System
As you may know, the main objective of an OS is to manage 4 resources:

The goal of this application is to provide explanations about different approaches to each problem and to illustrate how the each algorithm works by means of simulations. For that purpose, this app allows you to provide your own datasets and check how each algorithm would perform on them.
In order to understand an OS deeply, one must know how these algorithms work and why some approaches that seem reasonable have been discarded by well-known Operating System such as Windows or Linux.
Page replacement is a process of swapping out an existing page from the frame of a main memory and replacing it with the required page.
